FuncDef: The display bas-interface mapping command displays the mapping between BAS interfaces in slot/sub-slot/port and slot/port formats.

ParaDef.Info:
Displays the mapping based on the specified BAS interface in slot/port format.
-

Displays the mapping based on the specified BAS interface in slot/sub-slot/port format.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By default, BAS interfaces are displayed in slot/sub-slot/port format. You can run the display bas-interface mapping command to check the mapping between BAS interfaces in slot/sub-slot/port and slot/port formats in the following scenarios:
The calling-station-id attribute encryption format supported by Redback devices is configured on a Huawei device using the radius-server format-attribute calling-station-id vendor 2352 version1 command in the RADIUS server group view.The BAS interface format in calling-station-id and calling-number AVP attributes to be sent by a device is set to slot/port using the avp calling-number interface-format exclude sub-slot command in the L2TP group view.
When you run the display bas-interface mapping command:
If no parameter is specified, the mapping of all BAS interfaces is displayed.If mapping-interface or source-interface is specified, the mapping of the specified BAS interface is displayed.

Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
